Ingredients: 30 arrowroot cookies broken into small pieces

Directions: Mix sugar, butter and egg. bring to boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Remove from heat.
Add marshmallows. Stir until melted. Add rest of ingredients.
Press into 8 x 8 inch buttered pan.

Topping Directions: Beat together and spread over top of biscuit mixture.
Cut into small squares when set.

Directions: Melt butterscotch chips, butter (or margarine) in a pot. Stir in peanut butter and a small handful of chocolate chips.
Let cool slightly.
Add coconut, vanilla and marshmallows.
Spread in buttered 9"x9" pan.
Keep refrigerated.
Cream butter and white sugar. Add eggs one at a time, then add vanilla and almond extract.
Mix flour, baking powder and salt together.
Add flour mixture alternately with milk to creamed mixture in thirds.
Fold in blueberries - do not overmix.
Spoon into paper lined muffin pans and sprinkle with demerara sugar.
Bake at 375 degrees F. for 30 minutes.
Cool in pans for 10 minutes then remove to racks to finish cooling.

Ingredients: 1 - 10 fluid ounce crushed pineapple and juice

Directions: Mix first four ingredients together. Stir together flour, cinnamon, baking soda and salt. Stir this into first wet mixture.
Stir in last four ingredients.
Spread into a 9" x 13" pan which has been greased.
Bake at 350 degrees F. for 40 minutes.

Frosting for Cake: Beat until smooth. Spread on cooled cake.

Ingredients: 1 1/2 cups plus 2 tablespoons all purpose flour

Directions: Mix dry ingredients together.
Mix wet ingredients together. (Sugar usually counts as a wet ingredient.)
Then quickly stir the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
Use paper liners for the muffin pans. Makes 1 dozen muffins.
Bake at 375 degrees F. for 20 minutes.
Combine wet ingredients until foamy.
Add rhubarb and pecans.
Mix dry ingredients together and stir into wet ingredient mixture.
Spoon into paper lined muffin pans. Then sprinkle with topping given below
Makes 18 to 24 muffins. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 25 to 30 minutes.

Topping Ingredients: 2 tablespoons white sugar mixed with 1 teaspoon cinnamon

Directions: In a mixing bowl, stir in all ingredients in the order listed.
Spoon into paper lined muffin pans.
Sprinkle with topping mixture.
Bake at 375 degrees F. for 20 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.

Ingredients: 2 cups chopped rhubarb (approximately 4 good sized stalks)

Directions: Cream togehter the margarine and brown sugar
Add in 2 beaten eggs
Sift the dry ingredients together
Add the sifted dry ingredients to the creamed mixture alternately with the 1 C milk
Fold in the chopped rhubarb
Spread in buttered 8" x 11" pan and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons white sugar mixed with 2 teaspoons cinnamon.
Bake at 350 degrees F. for 40-45 minutes.

Ingredients: 2 cups grated zucchini (do not peel zucchini but do cut off the seeds)
1/2 cup sour milk (1 teaspoon vinegar in fresh milk)
a couple handfuls of dark chocolate chips

Directions: Cream margarine and sugar. Add oil, slightly beaten eggs and vanilla.
Sift dry ingredients together and add to sugar/oil mixture alternately with sour milk.
Fold in grated zucchini.
Spread in 13 x 9 inch pan and sprinkle top with couple handfuls of chocolate chips.
Bake at 350 degrees F for 30 to 35 minutes.

Ingredients: 1 3.4 ounce lemon flavour instant pudding mix

Directions: Combine ingredients and beat for 2 minutes.
Pour batter into greased and floured bundt pan.
Bake at 350 degrees F. for 50 - 60 minutes.

Icing: Sift icing sugar and stir in lemon juice. Drizzle over cooled lemon cake.

Filling: stir dates and water over low heat until thick

Crust: cream together margarine and brown sugar
stir in flour, soda, and salt

Baking: spread 1/2 of crust mixture in greased 13" x 19" pan
top with remainder of crust mixture
bake at 400 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes

Directions: Cream the butter with the white sugar.
Add the eggs, one at a time. Add the vanilla.
Mix the baking powder and flour together.
Stir the baking soda into the yoghurt.
Add the flour mixture and the yoghurt mixture alternately to the creamed mixture in thirds.
Mix the brown sugar and cinnamon together.
Grease and flour a bundt pan.
Spoon about 1/4 of the batter into the bottom of the bundt pan, then sprinkle the brown sugar/cinnamon mixture then the rest of the batter.
Bake at 350 degrees F. for 35 minutes or until tooth pick inserted in centre of cake comes out clean.

Directionsfor Crust: Combine crumbs, sugar and melted butter.
Press into 9" x 3" springform pan. Chill.

Directions: Cream cheese until soft, beat in sugar.
Add egg yolks, one at a time, stir in sour cream, flour, vanilla and lemon juice until smooth.
Beat egg whites stiff and fold into first mixture.
Bake 350 degrees F. for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Let cake cool in oven (after turning it off) for 1 hour.
Sprinkle graham crumbs and icing sugar on top when totally cooled.
Beat eggs slightly. Add sugar, oil and pumpkin and beat thoroughly.
Sift dry ingredients together and blend into first mixture.
Stir in raisins.
Line muffin pans with paper muffin liners. Spoon batter into muffin pans.
Bake 400 degrees F. for 15 minutes or until toothpick inserted into centre of one muffin comes out clean.
Makes about 2 dozen muffins.
Blend cake mix, sour cream. oil, white sugar, water and eggs.
Beat on high with electric beater for 2 minutes.
Pour 2/3 batter into greased and floured bundt pan.
Combine filling ingredients and sprinkle over batter in bundt pan.
Spread remaining batter over the filling.
Bake 375 degrees F. for 45 to 55 minutes or until toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean.
Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
Cream the shortening with the white sugar. Add the eggs one at a time. Add the vanilla.
Add the flour mixture to the creamed mixture alternately with the sour cream in thirds.
Spoon half the batter into a greased and floured bundt pan.
Sprinkle batter with brown sugar and cinnamon mixed together.
Spoon in rest of batter.
Bake at 350 degrees F. for 45 to 55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in centre comes out clean.
Mix sugar and flour together.
In a saucepan, bring to a boil the margarine, cocoa and water.
Add to the flour, sugar mixture and beat well.
Add the eggs, soda and vanilla. Beat well.
Pour into greased 9" x 13" pan or 2 round 8" pans.
Bake 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes.

Frosting Directions: Bring to a boil in a saucepan the butter, cocoa and the milk.
Add the icing sugar, vanilla and the nuts.
Pour on the cake while still hot and place under broiler until it bubbles.

Directions: Cream butter (or margarine) and sugars. Stir in egg and vanilla.
Sift dry ingredients together and stir into creamed mixture.
Stir in chocolate chips and pecans.
Roll into balls about the size of walnuts. Place on ungreased cookie sheets and cool for at least one hour before baking.
Bake 325 degrees F. for 15 to 18 minutes.
Cream the shortening and the two sugars. Add the egg and vanilla and beat until fluffy.
Sift the flour, baking soda and salt together into the first creamed mixture and blend well.
Stir in the nuts and chocolate chips.
Form into balls and place on ungreased cookie sheets and flatten.
Bake at 375 degrees F. for 8 to 10 minutes.
Cream margarine with sugars.
Stir in egg, peanut butter and vanilla.
Stir dry ingredients together and add to creamed mixture.
Roll into balls. Dip into white sugar. Place on cookie sheet and flatten slightly.
Bake at 375 degrees F. for 10 minutes.
In a large heavy pot melt the caramels with the cream.
Stir in the coconut and the peanuts. Then carefully stir in the cornflakes trying not to crush them.
Drop in bite sized blobs onto non-stick pan.
Let cool. Freeze good.
Cream margarine and sugar.
Add eggs and vanilla.
Stir in flour and baking powder. Fold in Nuts and dates.
Drop by teaspoonsful onto ungreased pans.
Bake at 350 degrees F. for 10 to 12 minutes.
Warm the butter and syrup in a small sauce pan until the butter is melted. Let cool.
Mix the rest of the ingredients together.
Add the cooled butter/syrup mixture to the dry ingredients and stir to make a soft dough.
Roll thin and cut out into desired shapes.
Bake 350 degrees F. for 8 to 10 minutes.
Original recipe from allrecipes.com
Sift dry ingredients together.
Cream margarine and the 1 cup white sugar together until light and fluffy.
Beat in egg. Stir in water and molasses.
Stir dry ingredients into the creamed mixture.
Shape into walnut sized balls and roll in sugar.
Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets and flatten slightly.
Bake at 350 F for 10 to 12 minutes.
Cream shortening and sugars.
Add egg and vanilla.
Stir in peanut butter.
Mix dry ingredients together and stir into peanut butter mixture.
Roll into balls and flatten slightly with a fork.
Bake 375 degree F. for 12 - 15 minutes.

Ingredients: 1 C walnuts, toasted and coarsely chopped

Directions: In large bowl, using electric mixer, beat butter with brown sugar until fluffy
Beat in maple syrup and vanilla
Beat in eggs, 1 at a time
In separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt
Stir into butter mixture in 2 additions to form slightly sticky dough
Stir in walnuts
Divide dough in half
On lightly floured surface, roll each into a 12-inch long log
Place 3 inches apart on parchment paper lined baking sheet
Press to flatten to 2 1/2 inches wide
Bake at 325 F for 30 minutes, or until light golden and firm to the touch
Let cool on pan on wire rack for 30 minutes
Transfer logs to cutting board
Cut crosswise on slight diagonal into 1/2 inch thick slices
Stand slices up, 1 inch apart, on baking sheet
Bake in 300 F oven for 30 minutes or until almost dry
Transfer to wire rack and let cool completely

Maple Glaze: In small bowl, whisk icing sugar with maple syrup
With cooled biscotti sitting side-by-side, drizzle glaze over tops
Separate slightly and let stand until set, about 15 minutes

Directions: Cream shortening and sugar.
Add eggs and vanilla.
Stir dry ingredients into egg and shortening mixture.
Roll into balls. Then press tops into sesame seeds and then into 2 teaspoons cinnamon mixed with 2 tablespoons white sugar.
Bake at 400 degrees F. for 12 minutes.

Ingredients: 2/3 small bag of white mini marshmallows

Directions: Combine graham wafer crumbs, melted margarine, white sugar and cinnamon and press into a 9" x 13" pan.
Whip the whipping cream and fold in the mini marshmallows. Spread over the graham base in the pan.
Spread the cherry pie filling over the top and refrigerate.

Ingredients: 1/2 C finely chopped nuts (almonds, pecans, or walnuts would be good)

Directions: Dissolve 1 tablespoon yeast in 1/4 cup warm water and 1 teaspoon white sugar.
Combine scalded milk, 1/4 cup white sugar, salt, and shortening
Cool to lukewarm then add yeast mixture and 1 3/4 C flour and beat well.
Let rise until very light.
Then add egg and an additional 1 3/4 C flour
Mix well and let rise.
Roll to 1/2 inch thick, brush with melted butter and sprinkle with brown sugar and nuts
Roll up as for cinnamon buns but then join the two ends together to form a ring on a greased cookie sheet.
Cut ring partially through from the outside edge at 2 inch intervals.
Partially turn each slice to show the edges with the filling.
Let rise and bake at 400 F for 30 minutes.
Frost while still warm (not hot).
To double, double all ingredients except only increase yeast to 1 1/2 Tbsp
Pour boiling water over shortening and add sugar and molasses. Beat thoroughly. When a little cooler add egg and beat again.
Sift dry ingredients together and add to first mixture - beat smooth.
Pour into a well greased 8 inch square baking pan.
Bake at 350 degrees F. for 35 minutes.
Good with custard sauce!

First Layer Directions: Cut margarine into flour/sugar mixture. Add chopped almonds.
Bake at 350 degrees F. for 12 - 15 minutes.

Second Layer Directions: Cream the cream cheese with the icing sugar. Make sure you sift the icing sugar to get rid of the lumps after you measure it.
Spread on the first layer after it has cooled.

Third Layer Ingredients: 2 small packages pistachio instant pudding mix

Third Layer Directions: Mix the pudding powders with the milk and stir with a whisk.
Pour onto cream cheese layer and let set.

Fourth Layer Ingredients: second half of the Cool Whip

Fourth Layer Directions: Spread second half of the Cool Whip onto the set pudding layer.

Yudane Directions: prepare the yudane the night before
add the 200 g flour to a medium sized bowl

gently bring milk to a simmer in a small pot.  Use enough milk to be sure there will be 200 g to add to the flour.  Consider using about twice the amount, then make a nice milk and honey drink with whatever is left :-)
once simmering, immediately measure the 200 g and then add it to the flour.  Stir quickly, just enough until no dry flour remains

Next Day: the following day, remove all cold ingredients (yudane, yeast, margarine, eggs) from the fridge 2 to 3 hrs before starting the dough recipe.  Place the yudane in the oven with the light on (still covered).
2 to 3 hrs later, begin making the dough
gently bring the milk to about 55 or 60 C in a small pot.  Again, be sure there will be 200 g available once heating and measuring is complete
measure the 200 g milk in to a large bowl, then monitor temperature until at approx 50 C
add the sugar and yeast, stir, and let sit for 5 minutes
add the eggs, margarine/butter, and salt
tear the yudane into walnut sized pieces and mix in
add the 600 g flour about a cup at a time until a nice dough forms in the bowl
transfer to a lightly floured surface
knead until the dough passes the "window pane" test
cover with plastic wrap and place in the oven (light on) for 1 hour
after 1 hr, remove dough from oven and punch it down

roll out to a rectangle approximately 14 x 22 inches.  Tip - to get a nice rectangle shape, roll to a rough rectangle, then fold in thirds so the long end shifts 90 degrees, then roll out in this new orientation
lightly butter, leaving 1 inch unbuttered on one side
mix the brown sugar and cinnamon in a bowl, then sprinkle over the butter

roll the dough (from the opposite end of the 1 inch unbuttered side) into a log (so it ends up as long as the longest side of the rectangle).  Don't roll too tight, or the centers will pop out while baking.
use a ruler or tape measure and make marks every 2 inches along the roll (not as big of a pain as it sounds)
using dental floss, slide the floss under the roll, then cross on top and pull tight to cut the roll into individual buns
place the buns on a parchment paper covered baking sheet.
pinch the "tails" a bit to keep the rolls from unravelling.  Buns can also be place with the tails butted together.
cover with plastic wrap (or whatever your preferred rising covering is) and place in the oven (with light on) for another hour
remove buns from oven
pre-heat oven to 375 F with tray on lower 1/3 rack position
bake for about 18 minutes
remove from oven, let stand 15 minutes
while cooling, mix icing ingredients together
once cooled, top with icing.

Directions: Cream together the butter and sugar.
Add the lemon juice and the egg yolks and beat.
Add the flour and the milk.
Beat the egg whites stiff and fold in.
Pour into an unbuttered 8 x 8 inch pan. Place pan inside another larger roasting pan and once in oven pour hot water in larger pan until it comes half way up sides of pan the pudding is in.
Bake in a 350 degree F. oven for 45 minutes.
Mix all ingredients together.
Fill unbaked tart shells 3/4 full with filling.
Add raisins, pecans or walnuts.
Bake at 450 degrees F. for 12 to 14 minutes.
Combine flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.
Cut butter into dry ingredients.
Beat egg with milk and combine with dry ingredients, mixing lightly with a fork.
Pat out on a board into an oblong about 1/2 inch thick.
Spread with jam and roll up like a jelly roll, tucking in ends so they do not leak.
Make a few slits in the top and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon.
Bake at 375 degrees F. for 40 minutes.

Tips: It helps if you pat it out on parchment paper to lift it into the pan - just leave it on the paper to cook.

Directions: This recipe makes 2 loaves
Heat milk and butter to melt. Let cool.
Pour 1/2 cup warm water in small bowl with sugar. Add yeast. Stir. Set aside for 5 minutes.
In large bowl pour in 1 cup warm water, salt, yeast mixture, and milk & butter mixture
Add flour one cup at a time. By fifth cup you will need to work it in by hand. Add enough flour to make a soft dough.
Put in greased bowl and grease top. Let rise 1 hour. Punch down. Knead 5 minutes. Divide in 2 and form into 2 loaves in 2 greased loaf pans. Let rise about 45 minutes.
Bake 375 degrees F. for 45 minutes. Remove from pans to cool (lay on sides so they do not collapse).

Yudane Directions: Make the yudane the night before by mixing the flour and boiling water in a medium sized bowl, cover with cling wrap, let sit for an hour, then refrigerate overnight.

Next Day: This recipe makes 2 loaves
Heat milk and butter to melt. Let cool.
Pour 1/4 cup warm water in small bowl with sugar. Add yeast. Stir. Set aside for 5 minutes.
In large bowl pour in milk & butter mixture, salt, and yeast mixture.
Pull the yudane into walnut sized pieces and mix in
Add the flour, a cup at a time, until a nice dough forms
Knead until passing windowpane test
Put in greased bowl and grease top. Let rise 1 hour. Punch down. Knead 5 minutes. Divide in 2 and form into 2 loaves in 2 greased loaf pans. Let rise about 45 minutes.
Bake 375 degrees F. for 45 minutes. Remove from pans to cool (lay on sides so they do not collapse).

Directions: Heat the milk. Stir in the salt, the 1/2 cup sugar, the shortening, and the 3/4 cup water. Let cool.
Measure the other 1/2 cup warm water into a small bowl. Stir in the 2 teaspoons sugar and sprinkle on the yeast. Let stand for 10 minutes, then stir to blend.
Stir the milk mixture into the yeast mixture after it has cooled. Add the well beaten egg.
Stir in about 3 1/2 cups of the flour and beat until smooth and elastic.
Work in 2 cups of raisins and about 3 3/4 cups more flour to make a soft dough.
Knead for 10 minutes.
Let rise to double in size - about 1 - 1 1/2 hours. Punch down.
Divide into 3 equal loaves and shape into loaf shape and place in greased pans.
Let rise 1 - 1 1/2 hours.
Bake 400 degrees F. for 30 - 35 minutes.

Ingredients: 1 egg white, beaten with a fork

Directions: Mix together the all purpose flour and the cake and pastry flour, the baking powder, the baking soda, salt and white sugar.
Cut the margarine into the flour mixture.
Add the raisins or dried fruit to the flour mixture.
Mix together the egg, the sour cream and the milk.
Add to the flour/fruit mixture to make a soft dough. You may need more milk - up to 1 cup in total.
Pat out on board to about 1" thick. Spread with a beaten egg white and sprinkle with sugar.
Cut into triangles and place on baking sheets lined with parchment paper.
Bake 425 degrees F. for 15 minutes.
Measure 1 cup warm water, 1 tablespoon white sugar and 1 tablespoon yeast into 2-cup measuring cup. Stir in yeast.
When yeast mixture froths up to 2-cup measure pour it into a larger bowl.
Add the 1/4 to 1/2 cup white sugar (depending on how sweet a bun you want), the oil, the eggs and the salt.
Whisk in 3 cups of the flour until smooth.
Add another 3 1/2 to 5 cups flour until smooth and elastic and not sticky.
Let rise until double about 1 1/2 hours.
Do not punch down. Make into buns and let rise again - about 1 hour.
Bake 400 degrees F. for 10 to 12 minutes.
Makes about 2 dozen big buns.
Dissolve yeast in 1/2 cup warm water to which the pinch of sugar has been added. Let sit for 10 minutes.
Add the other ingredients to the yeast mixture in order with enough flour to make a soft dough.
Let rise for around 1 hour. Punch down.
Cut off pieces and roll into saucer shapes - thin and about 5 inches across. Let rest for 20 minutes under plastic wrap - so they do not dry out.
Preheat oven and pan to 500 degrees F.
Open oven door quickly and place a couple pitas on the pan at a time. Bake for 3 - 5 minutes until they puff up and turn golden.
Slice the cucumbers and onions thin.
Mix the pickling salt in the water.
Pour the salt water into an enamel or plastic bowl and add the sliced cucumbers and onions.
Soak overnight.
Drain and rinse.
Boil vinegar, sugar and spices for 5 minutes.
Add cucumbers and onions. Bring just to boil but do not boil.
Pack into sterilized sealers and seal.

Ingredients: 4 pounds ripe tomatoes - peeled and chopped

Directions: Combine all ingredients in large pot.
Simmer until thick - uncovered - about 1 hour. Stir often to make sure it does not burn.
Spoon into hot sterilized jars and process in hot water bath for 10 minutes.
Cook beets in batches until tender with 2 teaspoons of the pickling salt. Dump into cold water and the peels will slip off.
Bring vinegar, rest of salt, water, sugar and spices (in a spice bag) to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Pack beets loosly into jars. You can leave them whole if very small or slice them or cut into chunks.
Pour liquid over the beets in the sealers and seal.
Bring water, vinegar, salt and sugar to a boil.
Pack sealers with dill cucumbers, dill weed, a couple garlic cloves, a bay leaf and some peppercorns.
Fill sealers to within 1/2 inch of top with brine.
With tops loose, cover sealers with boiling water. Let cool.
This amount of brine makes about 4 quarts.

Ingredients: 12 cups grated zucchini, seeded but not peeled

Directions: Toss zucchini and onion with salt. Refrigerate overnight. In the morning rinse with cold water and drain.
Mix mustard, celery seed, turmeric and black pepper.
In a pot heat vinegar, sugar, spices, chopped pepper and zucchini/onion mixture.
Simmer for approximately 20 minutes - until vegetables are tender.
Put in freezer containers and freeze or spoon into sterilized jars and process 25 minutes in hot water bath.
Makes about 14 - 1 cup jars.

Ingredients: 10 cups shredded zucchini - not peeled but seeds removed

Directions: Day One: Combine zucchini, onions, peppers and pickling salt in large enamel or plastic bowl. Cover. Let sit over night.

Day Two: Rinse. Drain well. Put into large cooking pot. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil and let simmer for 15 minutes. Pour into sterilized jars and process for 15 minutes in hot water bath. Makes 8 - 2 cup sealers.
Slowly cream sour cream into cream cheese to make a creamy mixture.
Add all other ingredients and refrigerate.
Best made ahead of time to let the flavours set up.
Mix oats, walnuts, sunflower seeds, almonds, pecans, grape nut cereal, sesame seeds and coconut in a large bowl.
In a saucepan simmer brown sugar, oil, water, honey, cinnamon and nutmeg until sugar is dissolved - about 10 minutes. Do not boil. Add vanilla.
Pour over dry ingredients in bowl and stir until well coated.
Spread out on cookie sheet and bake in 300 degree F. oven for 25 to 30 minutes.
Add the dates after it is taken out of the oven.
Start early in the day - around lunch time if you want the Yorkshire puddings for supper
Beat the 3 eggs together.
Add the milk and beat again.
Add the flour and salt and beat again.  Add an additional Tbsp or two of flour if mixture looks too thin.  Should be about the consistency of crepe batter.
Leave unrefrigerated.  Every hour or so, until ready to cook, give them a good beating - a hand beater or electric beater works fine.
Heat the muffin pans with a small amount of fat in them in a 450 degree F. oven. for approx 5 to 10 minutes.
Beat one last time, then fill the pan wells 2/3 full with batter.
If any wells remain unfilled (only oil), fill with some bread to prevent smoking
Bake at 450 degrees F. for 15 minutes then reduce heat to 350 degrees F. and bake for 10 to 15 minutes longer.
